The former captain of the White Whale who now
oversees New LA's provisional government.

A native of Mira whose whimsical manner of speech
befits his folksy personality.

A native of Mira. Opening a stall in New LA marked
the start of a fresh and exciting city life.

A Pathfinder and fantastic marksman who leads
Team Belisarda.
Whereabouts currently unknown.

A Pathfinder and exceedingly logical man who is armed
with untiring ambition and scholarly acumen.

An Interceptor and member of Team Irina, Gwin is an
honest man with an unshakable sense of justice.

Though this Interceptor loves knocking back drinks,
his courage has earned him the name "Killer Ostrich."

A Harrier who is competent in all aspects of combat,
especially when it comes to Skells.

An unwieldy Reclaimer who makes his personal
stomping grounds in the commercial district.
A Reclaimer bent on locating his former partner's body.

A veteran Harrier with a service record dating back to
the Coalition. He's deeply interested in eastern culture.

A Prospector who adheres to his own natural rhythm,
he claims no team and carries out assignments alone.

A Prospector who possesses a polar-opposite personality
to his older sibling, Frye.

A Reclaimer and former colonel in the Coalition Heavy
Armor Training Unit—known as the "Skelleton Crew."

A Reclaimer and disguised xenoform who shared info
with humans—including Earth's impending doom.

A young Outfitter and genius mechanic whose skills
extend to Skell tech and beyond.

A Prospector who constantly strives to protect her pacifist
friend Rock from having to participate in combat.

A gutsy, cool-headed Interceptor who takes pride in
protecting the good people of New LA.

This Curator's remarkable field skills are contrasted by a
greed so intense she will betray even fellow BLADEs.

A Curator who hails from a wealthy household.
Alas, the sins of one man left her with nothing.

An Outfitter charged with testing new weapons.
None can pry her from the gadgets and Skells she loves.

A Mediator of great character beloved by nearly
everyone in New LA.

A Mediator who protects the teachings of her late father
by toiling tirelessly for the people of New LA.

A Curator and junior BLADE who is still learning the
ropes.

The commander of BLADE, an organization tasked with
protecting humans on their new alien home.

This man feels that favorable outcomes demand sacrifice,
a stance that leads to frequent clashes with Nagi.

A mysterious xenoform on the run with Celica.
His hulking exterior hides a warm personality.

A mysterious xenoform on the run with Celica.
He now works in the industrial district.

The former captain of the White Whale who now
oversees New LA's provisional government.

A Qlurian girl who came to Mira with her friend Rock.
She has a strong sense of responsibility and loyalty.

Her dreams of joining the BLADE ranks have been
thwarted by repeated aptitude-test failures.

This girl, who wanted to be a BLADE above all else,
now moves to the next phase of her adventures.

A former prince who continues to brandish his blade in
honor of a sacred Wrothian code of justice.

A Wrothian warrior who has served as Ga Jiarg's
right hand since childhood.
A Nopon who was kept in Prone coffers as food.

A Nopon who was kept in Prone coffers as food.
Lin took him in, and they are now inseparable.
A Harrier who leads Team Jaeger.

A former Harrier and leader of Team Jaeger, killed
by the Prone while trying to protect Grette.
An Interceptor with many qualms with xenoforms.

An Interceptor who bears a deep-seated hatred toward
xenoforms.

A man being coaxed into buying Miralife Cards,
a hot new collectible, by his discerning secretary.

An Interceptor with immature fashion sense and a mouth
to match.

Deterred by sympathy, this Interceptor failed to eliminate
an indigen that later ended up killing him.
An Outfitter who leads Team Gus.

An Outfitter who leads Team Gus.
He became a meal for an indigen he taunted.

An Outfitter who leads Team Gus. He's now on the
lam after stealing the Crimson Tear, a rare jewel.
A Reclaimer set on pilfering Professor B's technology.

This Outfitter is a seasoned Skell pilot and frequent
tester of new mobile weapons tech.
A Curator who leads Team Quincy.

A Curator who leads Team Quincy and is known for
being kind to a fault.

An Outfitter who owns a Skell affectionately nicknamed
Aphrodite.

An Outfitter who owns a Skell nicknamed Aphrodite,
though he now has a new lover in the form of Dana.

An Outfitter who owns a Skell affectionately nicknamed
Aphrodite. He only possesses eyes for Skells, it seems.
A brilliant engineer.

A brilliant mimeosome engineer, as well as a candidate
for Lyvia's love.

A brilliant mimeosome engineer and former candidate
for Lyvia's love. Unfortunately, he was turned down.
A Pathfinder who leads Team Corwin.

A Pathfinder who leads Team Corwin and strives to
pioneer the entirety of Mira.

A Pathfinder who leads Team Corwin. He was attacked
by Definian forces, which he managed to valiantly repel.

A Pathfinder who once led Team Corwin.
He gave his life charging a Definian Skell on foot.
A researcher studying xenoform physiology.

He was troubled by hazardous research byproducts
until Shiraton reached out to him.
This Reclaimer is a frequent patron of Army Pizza.

This Reclaimer was a frequent patron of Army Pizza
until a bomb planted by Powell ended his dining days.

This Reclaimer was a frequent patron of Army Pizza
until a toxic slice cooked up by Powell proved his last.
A Mediator.

A Mediator and colleague to Ackwar who is always
cleaning up after the Ma-non's rash actions.

A Mediator and colleague to Ackwar who has formed a
working partnership with the rash Ma-non.

A Mediator who idolizes both justice and the comic-
book heroes he loved as a child.

A villain who terrorized New LA. He desired to be
brought to justice, but was ultimately denied.

A villain who terrorized New LA. He took a bullet in the
name of justice, ending his nefarious spree and his life.

This Interceptor fancies himself a prime physical
specimen.

This Interceptor fancies himself a prime physical
specimen, and is also a candidate for Lyvia's love.

This Interceptor fancies himself a prime specimen, and
was a candidate for Lyvia's love before being denied.

This Interceptor fancies himself a prime physical
specimen, and was also a candidate for Lyvia's love.

A Curator and BLADE academy instructor.
He has taught many an operative.
A Harrier and member of Team Jaeger.

A Harrier and member of Team Jaeger.
He looks after the traumatized Phina.

A Prospector who provides protection services as a side
job. Currently under the employ of the Nopon Zazazan.

He bolted after stealing Zazazan's cargo,
but paid the ultimate price.

The owner of Army Pizza. His signature grenade pizza
would be a surefire hit if he could just get customers...

The owner of Army Pizza. His signature grenade pizza
is a massive hit among the Ma-non.

Powell's wife died amidst a sea of complaints from
Ma-non, spurring him to become a vengeful serial killer.
A Curator and chopper pilot serving on Team Roscoe.

A Curator serving on Team Roscoe. A chopper crash
while en route to New LA caused his untimely demise.
A Mediator tasked with safeguarding the west gate.
A Mediator who cracks cases with Zaruboggan aid.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Corwin. Though his
utterances are shallow, his actions get the job done.

A Harrier and Wang's team member.
A Ganglion attack took his life.

This man earns his daily bread by reading poetry in
New LA.

A former BLADE and Celeste Three member who earns
his daily bread by reading poetry in New LA.

An ex-Celeste Three member. He opted not to disobey
Briggs's orders, and aided his treachery as a result.

An ex-Celeste Three member. He worked with Briggs
and Moorehouse to keep folks away from a treasure.

He threatened Fosdyke and company to attain valuable
white gold, and now guards the safe that houses it.

A Celeste Three member who attacked BLADE forces
along with Fosdyke and Moorehouse.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Corwin whose
enthusiasm is unfortunately not matched by his skill.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Corwin who
diligently strives to one day be like Corwin himself.

He hid from the Ganglion in a contaminated area,
which proved a deadly lapse in judgment.
This man exudes a dark and smoldering passion.

A man who stole Zaruboggan voltant for terrorist
motives.

A maintenance foreman assigned to the industrial
district.
A sensitive youth versed in an array of fine arts.
A sensitive youth and boyfriend candidate of Lyvia.

A sensitive youth and former boyfriend candidate of
Lyvia. Unfortunately, he was turned down.
A man who shuns all connections with society.

A Celeste Three member who attacked BLADE forces
along with Fosdyke and Briggs.

A tech-head who'd rather spend time sweating the day
away in the field, though his rank says otherwise.

An avid Ma-non-tech enthusiast, this operative has taken
a recent liking to the personalities of said xenoforms.

A serial killer responsible for the deaths of the
Murderess's parents.

A serial killer responsible for the deaths of the
Murderess's parents. Went by the name of Martin.

A young boy with a meek demeanor.
Assigned to the Outfitters.

Though young and meek, this Outfitter mustered his
courage to marry a Prone named Lavina.

An Outfitter who spends his days and nights training to
win Lavina's hand in marriage.

A buyer specializing in cars and scrap parts.
Known to cave to pressure.

A man who caved to Professor B and now works for
Factory 1.21, where he's busy around the clock.

An Interceptor having a hard time with BLADE's rookie
personnel.

An Interceptor who protects New LA in honor of his
friend Carl's dying wish.
A Curator who often takes on jobs toting resources.
A Pathfinder and prudent team leader.

A Pathfinder and team leader running missions with
Orphean help.

A wreaker of mischief within New LA's walls. His latest
scheme saw lobster plushies being scattered across town.
It turns out that Justin was the feared Blood Lobster.

A Curator and team leader who has a hard time
keeping subordinates in line.
A Curator and leader of a cozy, three-man team.

An Interceptor known to be rather clumsy.
He lost a comm device in the Miran wilderness.
A maintenance worker in the industrial district.

A maintenance worker in the industrial district.
Rock is his colleague.
A foreman brimming with compassion and loved by all.

A foreman. He likes working alongside Ajoa,
but won't hesitate to throw a playful jab her way.

A foreman stationed at the Biahno water-purification
plant. Perished in a sudden indigen attack.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Belisarda,
Lao's unit. He takes his work seriously.

A Pathfinder and subordinate to Lao.
He lost his life in a clash with the Ganglion.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Belisarda, Lao's unit.
Takes a lighthearted approach to things.

A Pathfinder and subordinate to Lao.
He lost his life in a clash with the Ganglion.

A Sakuraba sales rep interested in a firsthand look at
the state of the market. Frequents Armory Alley.
An Interceptor and member of Team Irina.

An Interceptor and member of Team Irina.
Killed in action during the attack on New LA.

A taciturn Pathfinder assigned to Lao's unit,
Team Belisarda.

A Pathfinder who was a member of Lao's Team
Belisarda. He perished in a Ganglion attack.

Under this Mediator's strapping physique is a true
heart of gold.

Lara Mara's older twin. Under this Mediator's strapping
physique is a true heart of gold.

A Mediator. Though his main duty is patrolling NLA's
interior, he sometimes takes jobs guarding other teams.
He runs the cathedral in the residential district.

A Sakuraba engineer who has been there since the early
days, racking up an impressive array of inventions.

A man who knows the buildings of New LA like the
back of his hand.
An engineer who keeps tabs on materials.

A Prospector with a lackadaisical attitude towards the
BLADE cause.
A Mediator entrusted with nighttime security.

A Mediator who spends off-duty hours organizing data
on Earth history for the viewing of future generations.

A man who enjoys a good round of sports for off-duty
stress relief.

This man's strong, fatherly aspects have gained him
widespread admiration from the young.

A man who is indebted to his colleague Rock,
who once saved his life.
A scientist studying Mira's environment alongside Ajoa.

An indigen attack on the Biahno water-purification plant
left this victim's body host to a vicious Miran parasite.
An Outfitter and Skell test pilot.
A Mediator who takes the mission seriously.

Deceased. The copy walking about is actually a Definian
named Dieara.
A Harrier who learned under Bozé at the academy.
A Prospector.

A Prospector and son to Leland Cole.
He keeps his family teachings close to heart.
A Prospector.

A Prospector. Though his mimeosome is young in
appearance, his true age sits in the seventies.

A Curator who works with Gwin, his superior.
Quite fond of cats.

A frequent visitor of Hope's who is mentally strapped
due to a work schedule that lasts well into the night.

Negotiations mediated by Hope have improved this
individual's work conditions and life.

An engineer who possesses remarkable skills.
He's also fond of mocking BLADE.

This engineer possesses remarkable skills.
He once mocked BLADE, but eventually learned respect.

A Curator who can be found loitering in back alleys.
Far from BLADE's finest.

A sub-par Curator who could often be found loitering in
back alleys. Died under mysterious circumstances.
An Interceptor.

An Interceptor known as Dale Gibbon.
He killed the Murderess's parents in cold blood.

A Harrier who entrusted his company to his secretary
in order to pursue a BLADE career.
HT665: Erio's human disguise.
LV757: Lyvia's human disguise.

He works with minerals, fashioning them into decorative
pieces.

An Interceptor whose indigen-busting missions are
proving too tall an order.

An Interceptor who recently bought a recommended item
from L to aid in indigen combat.
An Interceptor and team leader.

A diligent engineer who works with Brenna in weapons
R&D.

Ga Bewhe greets this mystery buyer with the title of
"Master."

The fourth member of the Celeste Three.
He lost everything to Ga Bewhe.
A weapons dealer shrouded in mystery.

He invented a new type of data probe. All the models,
however, were lost during the Whale's crash landing.

His battle probes—all previously lost in the White Whale
crash—have been reborn.
An earnest mechanic specializing in Skell repair.
A mechanic specializing in Skell repair.

A Pathfinder looking to utilize FrontierNav expertise in a
scheme for big bucks.

A former FrontierNav developer who tried to amass a
fortune in honor of a friend's final wishes.

A middle-aged master of feigned politeness.
Values money above all, despite being dead broke.

This Pathfinder's greatest fear is being left in the dust
by other teams.

His job is to attract and convince firms to become arms
manufacturers.

A Harrier and combat instructor known for putting
students through the wringer.

A Harrier and combat instructor working hard to induct
xenos into BLADE. His efforts are not welcomed by all.

He misuses Lifepods to run a business for those who
want to switch mimeosomes—and are willing to pay.

A Mediator who departed on orders to take an enemy
fortress. An intel leak lead to the operation's failure.

A Pathfinder who leads Team Enrai.
Pressed to raise funds to ensure the team's future.

Under this Mediator's strapping physique is a true
heart of gold.

Lara Nara's younger twin. These identical siblings get a
kick from assuming the guise of their counterpart.

A member of the research team formed to scout water
sources in the Miran wilderness.

A tester of water quality at the Biahno plant.
Became the host of a parasite, but managed to survive.

A tester of water quality at the Biahno plant.
Became the host of a parasite and met a grisly end.
A Harrier.
A Harrier and candidate to be Lyvia's girlfriend.

A Harrier and former candidate to be Lyvia's girlfriend.
Was rejected in the end.

She adores Eliza, and works day and night on a
campaign of equality for all New LA citizens.

A teamless Pathfinder looking for a good place to plant
roots.

A Pathfinder and member of Robert's team.
Prolonged periods without bathing make her sullen.

She continues a campaign to put freedom and equality
within the reach of every New LA citizen.

She tirelessly fights for a society in which humans and
xenoforms can join hands in harmony.

Calls the shots for a women's brand covering a broad
spectrum of needs.

Calls the shots for a women's brand that recently
rolled out a new Ma-non perfume.
A Harrier from Adelbert's Team Jaeger.

A Harrier who was captured and put to death by the
Prone.

A Prospector with an alarming hatred for xenoforms,
who she regards as inferior.

A Prospector who once hated xenoforms,
but saw the light after getting to know Inisae.
This waitress is a favorite among BLADE operatives.

A waitress and favorite among BLADE operatives.
She is also one of Lyvia's girlfriend candidates.

A waitress and favorite among BLADE operatives.
She was one of Lyvia's girlfriend candidates, but lost.
A Curator and member of Roscoe's team.
A woman looking to buy up weapons.

An Interceptor inclined to settle things with a scuffle,
though underneath the tough act burns a secret love.

An Interceptor inclined to settle things with a scuffle,
though she settled down since a boyfriend came along.

An Interceptor inclined to settle things with a scuffle.
She's become worse since being rejected romantically.

A lead designer who develops weapons and Skells for
arms manufacturers.

A lead designer of weapons and Skells who is also an
obsessive collector of Miralife Cards.

A Mediator with questionable judgment. Weekly false
arrests have made this operative the target of much flak.

A Mediator who no longer relies on a detective's
instincts to get the job done, but rather female instincts.
A Harrier and member of Team Jaeger.

A Harrier. Unable to overcome the traumatic loss of a
friend, this operative plans to leave BLADE behind.

A believer in the Bringer of Miracles who seeks to
spread the good word. Unfortunately, no one listens...

She propagated a strange faith among the Ma-non
population, but was ultimately exposed by Staccata.

She eventually tried to attain godhood, but went mad
after learning the whole thing was a Definian scheme.

This Prospector was an associate professor of biology
back on Earth.

An associate professor of biology back on Earth,
this Prospector now studies Zaruboggan.

A young, talented café manager who's surprisingly more
mature than her older employee.

She can't stand reptiles, and as such loathes the lizard-
like appearance of the Ma-non.

She was quick to judge Ma-non based on their looks,
but is now making an effort to like the quirky xenos.
Manages all tasks involving FrontierNav.

Manages all tasks involving FrontierNav, and is currently
researching a new and improved iteration of the system.

She heads waste disposal, a daunting post which she
takes on armed with a natural optimism.

She and her team of xenoforms toil night and day
to rid New LA of trash.

A barista-in-training cursed with the uncanny ability to
destroy technology on touch.

A café employee cursed with the uncanny ability to
destroy technology on touch.

A Pathfinder and member of Team Corwin. Keeps the
team united despite being second in command.

A Pathfinder and talented member of Team Corwin.
Dedicated to rebuilding the team alongside the captain.

A Pathfinder and talented member of Team Corwin.
The death of the captain left this operative deflated.
The younger employees love her like a mother.

The younger employees love her like a mother.
Miralife Cards are her latest craze.
A charismatic character working in Skell R&D.

This charismatic character working in Skell R&D is
a girlfriend candidate for Lyvia.

This charismatic character working in Skell R&D was a
girlfriend candidate for Lyvia, but was rejected.

A peace-seeker and Chausson supporter pushing
compromise with xenoforms through talks.

An active supporter of Orphean interaction,
and a pioneer of human-xeno relations.
A money-grubbing Prospector.

A Prospector who used Shiraton in a failed get-rich-
quick scheme, leaving only the debt for a totaled Skell.

A Prospector who exploited the Zaruboggan Shiraton
and others to run a seedy hazmat-processing racket.

A Curator and member of Nathan's team. Her caring
disposition makes her a favorite of young operatives.

A mysterious figure who receives off-record orders
from Chausson. Issues missions to operatives.

She works behind the scenes on Chausson's off-record
commands in order to build a lasting peace.

A member of the research team formed to scout water
sources in the Miran wilderness. Prone to jealousy.

A researcher stationed at the Biahno water-purification
plant. After the accident, she reformed her perspective.

A maintenance center employee with childish aspects.
Popular among patients due to a unique charm.
A restaurant cook.

A restaurant cook loved like a mother by BLADE
operatives.

A noncombatant crewman displeased with the
unfinished city.

A worker with a material management job in the
commercial district.

Works at Army Pizza under a hard-boiled boss,
though being able to make pies is reward in itself.

A landscaper working in the residential district.
Partial to fast-growing, annual plants.

A housekeeper working in the residential district.
Likes evergreens for their year-round lushness.

She solves hairy interpersonal conflicts that stump even
Mediators.
A woman with a passionate hatred for xenoforms.

A woman who once bore hatred for xenoforms,
but changed upon learning of their diverse thinking.

The secretary for a CEO. She seems to be blessed with
unusually sharp foresight.

Formerly a secretary, but now a CEO, this woman is
blessed with unusual foresight.

Even in these trying times, she actively engages in
sports.
Shares a house with roomies over in Ishmael Hills.

Helped build the White Whale back on Earth.
